page.title: 01Doonfoot & The Heads of Ayr
page.content: The area just SW of Ayr is mainly farmland. The agriculture is predominantly dairy. Much of the coast is rocky with sandy bays, which in the summer attracts holidaymakers. There is a Butlins Holiday Camp which lies on the coast, between Greenan Castle & the Heads of Ayr. It has a capacity of 7000 people & has an average of 4000 per week. It has many facilities but is only open 19 weeks of the year. This camp is well hidden & is only really obvious from the sea. The Heads of Ayr is a promintory & is a local landmark. It has its own caravan site, with a few facilities. To the extreme east of the area is Doonfoot, a residential part of Ayr. It consistys of modern housing development & is still expanding. It includes a large, modern primary school.
